messages: f109a63709e702ed304a85e971b0f710 (12:12): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, shepazu was talking to you earlier about svg acid test submissions?  it seems various svg dom method calls don't return anything useful when used on a document created by DOMImplementation.createDocument().
f109a63709e702ed304a85e971b0f710 (12:13): and while those calls should work, i think for the purpose of demonstrating the particular dom interfaces being tested, it'd be good to go the iframe route
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:13): yeah, that's a bug
f109a63709e702ed304a85e971b0f710 (12:13): i.e., could you include an <iframe> with an empty svg document?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:13): i think you misunderstand how acid tests work :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:13): the more broken things you rely on for the test, the better :-)
f109a63709e702ed304a85e971b0f710 (12:14): so you'd rather a submission like that then?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:14): sure
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:14): i can always tweak it later if necessary
f109a63709e702ed304a85e971b0f710 (12:15): (btw doug's gonna coordinate a few tests from us svg guys and send them in to you)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:15): it's so sad, i've received very few acid3 test submissions, and most of those that i have received have fundamentally missed at least one of the rules
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:15): (different rules each time)
f109a63709e702ed304a85e971b0f710 (12:16): do you have enough for the 10 at least? :)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:16): not even close
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:16): someone submitted 11 tests... for XMLHttpRequest
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:16): which isn't even in LC yet
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:16): let alone CR in 2004
f109a63709e702ed304a85e971b0f710 (12:17): i didn't have much time during the week, so i've really only been working on it the last few days
f109a63709e702ed304a85e971b0f710 (12:17): so just one test from me
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:17): every little bit helps :-)
f109a63709e702ed304a85e971b0f710 (12:17): enjoys tests involving non plane 0 characters
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:19): i got two tests from someone called Sylvain which look solid
8c8837db54a2907cacd8633547977e33 (12:29): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: think that's syp_, Sylvain Pasche
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:30): yup
162922e135c0af768927f1a6c966d3a9 (12:30): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: one question: do you expect the numbering of tests to remain stable?
8c8837db54a2907cacd8633547977e33 (12:31): thought the numbering stable enough to remove the note from <http://spreadsheets.google.com/pub?key=pNgBCwWdyRTT2JeiZn4B2Yw>
162922e135c0af768927f1a6c966d3a9 (12:31): I'm asking because I wonder whether it makes sense to refer to tests by number right now (when talking to other developers, noting down info)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:31): 162922e135c0af768927f1a6c966d3a9: not until the test is finished, no
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:32): http://chanweiyee.blogspot.com/2008/01/removal-of-ogg-vorbis-and-theora-from.html is hilarious
162922e135c0af768927f1a6c966d3a9 (12:32): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: ok. I'll refrain from adding comments to C++ then
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:32): "Nokia and Apple have privately pushed to remove Ogg in HTML5."
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:32): PRIVATELY?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:32): nokia published a position paper!
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:32): how much more public can you get!
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (12:32): They didn't mail it to me!
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:32): and then the change was twittered, e-mailed to TWO public lists, posted on slashdot, digg, and reddit!
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:33): what more can i possibly do to make this public!
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (12:35): Door to door announcements
f109a63709e702ed304a85e971b0f710 (12:35): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, where's that test submission test page again?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (12:39): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: I had a good WebKit-only CSS1 bug but hyatt went and fixed it
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (12:39): (granted, I goaded him into doing so)
f109a63709e702ed304a85e971b0f710 (12:40): btw are we not meant to use those assertEquals() and assert() and fail() functions?  they're not available from the test development console page.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:41): f109a63709e702ed304a85e971b0f710: that level of detail doesn't matter, i'll rewrite the tests to use those probably anyway
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:41): nn
